resources.string: Welcome to VisuAlgOl! This application was created to learn olympiad algorithms in informatics with the support of the HSE Lyceum. To continue, click the button below.
What is it and what is it for?

What is sorting? Sorting is ordering: arranging items in a sequence ordered by some criterion. For example, people at school in pe lessons and in the army are lined up by height, because the order is needed.
Soldiers lined up in a row

Bubble sort, sometimes referred to as sinking sort, is a simple sorting algorithm that repeatedly steps through the list to be sorted, compares each pair of adjacent items and swaps them if they are in the wrong order. The pass through the list is repeated until no swaps are needed, which indicates that the list is sorted.
